subject: Mental Health
title: Emotional Numbing
description: A short lesson to help you apply Emotional Numbing.

hook.text: Some PTSD survivors don't feel too much â€” they feel nothing at all.

buildup.text: Emotional numbing is the brain's way of protecting against overwhelming feelings.

discovery.text: It blunts not just pain but also joy, love, and connection.

twist.text: Partners often feel shut out, not realizing it's a trauma symptom, not a choice.

climax.text: Numbing and hyperarousal often alternate in cycles, confusing everyone involved.

punchline.text: Feeling nothing is the brain's last line of defense.

quiz.question: What does emotional numbing protect against?
